page.title: 02HOUSING & INDUSTRY, ALTHAM
page.content: { Altham}is a small village in the district of Hyndburn, Lancashire. It used be quite important because of its church. However, now it is only a hamlet and has no shops since the post office closed. There are virtually no public services except a bus route. An ambulance station serves the Hyndburn area. The Walton Arms used to be a pub but is now a restaurant. Also Martholme Grange, formally a private house, is now a night club-restaurant. Altham School with only 28 pupils and 2 teachers was scheduled for closure, but parents and friends ran a successful campaign, S.A.V.E. (Support Altham Village Education) and a reprieve was granted. This rural area boasts a developing industrial estate and 6 farms.
